posts._title: Gabriel Axel – Babettes gæstebud AKA Babette’s Feast (1987)
posts.title: Babettes gæstebud
posts.excerpt: In 19th century Denmark, two adult sisters live in an isolated village with their father, who is the honored pastor of a small Protestant church that is almost a sect unto itself. Although they each are presented with a real opportunity to leave the village, the sisters choose to stay with their father, to serve …

posts._title: Sidney J. Furie – Lady Sings the Blues [+ Commentary] (1972)
posts.title: Lady Sings the Blues [+ Commentary]
posts.excerpt: Lady Sings the Blues, like many enjoyable biopics, has little to do with presenting fact and everything to do with presenting the essence of a life. It has been both rightly and unfairly reviled by passionate fans of Holiday’s music as being highly fictionalized—and so it is, just as Amadeus, Funny Girl, and St. Louis …

posts._title: Shin’ya Tsukamoto – Tetsuo: The Bullet Man (2009)
posts.title: Tetsuo: The Bullet Man
posts.excerpt: Quote:Twenty years after making his breakout cult hit, “Tetsuo,” and 17 years after its sequel, “Tetsuo II: Body Hammer,” multihyphenate filmmaker Shinya Tsukamoto busts out the big guns again with “Tetsuo the Bullet Man.” Contempo-set pic doesn’t bring much new to the half-man-half-machine concept, but with its delirious editing and eardrum-crunching soundtrack, it punches above …

posts._title: Mojtaba Mirtahmasb & Jafar Panahi – In film nist AKA This Is Not a Film (2011)
posts.title: In film nist
posts.excerpt: The title of “This Is Not a Film” is itself a bitter joke on the illogic of totalitarian thinking. The acclaimed Iranian director Jafar Panahi has been banned by the state from all filmmaking activities for 20 years and, when we see him in this footage shot in 2011, he’s appealing a six-year prison sentence …

posts.title: Pica Pica
posts.excerpt: Quote:In Pica Pica Kristersson invites the viewer to be enthralled for an hour and a half by the vicissitudes of magpie life. Opposing himself to the current nature films that tend to highly compress time in order to end up with a concentrated sequence of action-elements Kristersson leaves rhythm and tempo almost completely up to …

posts._title: Jacques Doillon – La vie de famille AKA Family Life (1985)
posts.title: La vie de famille
posts.excerpt: This is an affecting story about a father’s attempts to mend the breaches in the relationship between himself and his 10-year-old daughter. Emmanuel (Sami Frey) is the father of Elise (Mara Goyet) by his first marriage, and the stepfather of an older daughter by his second marriage. He tries to make the best of both …

posts._title: Didier Le Pêcheur – Des nouvelles du bon Dieu AKA News From The Good Lord (1996)
posts.title: Des nouvelles du bon Dieu
posts.excerpt: When novelist Alessandro Battavia commits suicide, a taxi driver named Evangile and her brother Nord believe they are characters imagined in a novel, probably one written by God. Because they see their lives as “merde,” they go in search of God to get their story rewritten. Along the way, believing everything is imaginary anyway, they …

posts.title: Brutal
posts.excerpt: Short film on the economic conditions and aesthetic decisions of filmmaking. One of Eric M. Nilsson’s most acclaimed films.

posts._title: Aleksandr Gordon – Ogni pritona AKA Brothel Lights (2011)
posts.title: Ogni pritona
posts.excerpt: Quote:A richly outfitted journey backwards to daily life in small “family-run” brothel, the film is reminiscent of Federico Fellini’s 1973 Amarcord, set in a small Italian town along the coast in the 1930s.

posts._title: Claude Sautet – Un Coeur En Hiver AKA A Heart in Winter (1992)
posts.title: Un Coeur En Hiver
posts.excerpt: Beautiful violin virtuoso Camille has two obsessions: the music of Ravel, and a friend of her husband’s who crafts violins. But his heart seems to be as cold as her playing is passionate.
